evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On February 11, 2025, President Trump issued the Executive Order 14210 that is the subject of this lawsuit. Executive Order 14210 (hereinafter "Workforce Executive Order" or "Executive Order 14210") ordered all federal agencies to "commence[]" a "critical transformation of the Federal bureaucracy" for the purported purpose of "eliminating waste, bloat, and insularity." Exec. Order No. 14210, 90 Fed. Reg. 9669 (Feb. 11, 2025) (emphasis added), attached hereto as Exhibit A.

extracted.value: Executive Order 14210 issued on February 11, 2025, requiring federal agencies to implement 'large-scale reductions in force' (RIFs) to 'eliminate waste, bloat, and insularity' across the federal government, including mandating RIFs regardless of statutory authority or agency needs.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In late March, pursuant to the mandate of Executive Order 14210, the Department of Health and Human Services ("HHS") began eliminating more than 10,000 positions throughout the Center for Disease Control ("CDC"), Food and Drug Administration ("FDA"), the National Institutes of Health ("NIH"), among other programs, throwing the medical, public health, and scientific community into utter chaos.

extracted.value: HHS began eliminating over 10,000 positions across CDC, FDA, and NIH in late March 2025, causing chaos in public health and scientific communities.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: As of April 15, 2025, the IRS was slated to commence RIFs ultimately totaling 40% of its workforce, including over 50% of the tax enforcement staff (the very staff that brings in revenue to the government).

extracted.value: IRS commenced RIFs totaling 40% of its workforce (over 50% tax enforcement staff) by April 15, 2025, disrupting government revenue collection.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On April 22, 2025, the EPA began sending RIF notices to employees across its headquarters and regional offices.

extracted.value: EPA began sending RIF notices to employees across headquarters and regional offices on April 22, 2025, affecting environmental justice staff.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: President Trump has called his plan to downsize and transform the federal government as he desires "The 'Manhattan Project' of our time." ... "I got elected on the basis of making our government stronger and smaller, because we have millions of people that — obviously, they're paying millions of people that shouldn't be paid."

extracted.value: President Trump asserted constitutional authority to reorganize federal agencies without Congressional approval, claiming an 'unprecedented mandate' to 'reduce the size and scope of the federal government.'

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On April 7, 2025, Government Executive reported from USDA sources: Some employees have been told to expect the department to cut back to fiscal 2019 staffing levels—which would lead to USDA slashing around 9,000 of its 98,000 employees—while others have been told there is an overall federal workforce reduction number the administration has developed and the department will do its part proportionally to meet that target.

extracted.value: USDA plans to cut back to fiscal 2019 staffing levels, slashing around 9,000 of its 98,000 employees, as reported by Government Executive on April 7, 2025.
